composableStructure.description>: A batteries-included src tree with app, components, hooks, and utils directories scales with your project.

developerTooling.description>: ESLint, Prettier (with Tailwind sorting), and ready-to-run scripts keep your commits neat and repeatable.

localizationReady.description>: Tolgee client scaffolding and CLI scripts are already wired up whenever you are ready to translate copy.

opinionatedDefaults.description>: React 19, TypeScript, Vite 7, and Tailwind CSS ship preconfigured so you can focus on product work instead of tooling.

safeByDesign.description>: Strict TypeScript settings, React StrictMode, and sensible lint rules catch issues long before production.

utilityFirstStyling.description>: TailwindCSS is ready out-of-the-box with PostCSS so you can ship polished UI without touching config.

features.description>: Opinionated but flexible. Swap any tool or extend the stack without redoing the plumbing work.
features.heading>: Everything you need to ship fast

footer.message>: Built with ❤️ using the React Vite Starter template. Swap this hello page with your first feature!

header.description>: This friendly landing page is proof that everything is wired up. Replace it whenever you're ready, or keep it around as a quick-reference for scripts, stack, and docs.

resources.description>: Use this starter as a hello page, onboarding doc, or QA checklist. The faster everyone on the team can get into the app, the better your next release will be.
resources.heading>: From idea to prototype in minutes

prisma.description>: Dive into Prisma's ORM workflows, migrations, and tooling.

react.description>: Refresh modern React patterns, hooks, and compiler plans.

tailwind.description>: Browse utility classes and component recipes.

vite.description>: Understand how Vite handles dev, build, and previews.

steps.copyRepo>: Copy this repo or scaffold your own via Git.
steps.keepScripts>: Keep the scripts handy for linting, formatting, and Tolgee localization.
steps.runCommands>: Run the commands above to install dependencies and start dev mode.
steps.tweakSuffix>: or drop in your own routes.
